About Me

Hamid Abdul

M.Sc. Aerospace Engineering student at Universität Bremen. Experience in propulsion test data analysis, composite testing, CAD/CFD and Python-based data workflows.

My Career

Studentische Hilfskraft @ Faserinstitut Bremen

Simulation, testing, digitization and documentation for fiber composites. Tools include Ansys, CATIA, Python, G-code and CNC. Work on composite tanks for hydrogen storage (HYTANK), permeation testing, cryogenic analysis, CAD modelling and 3D printing.

Aug. 2023 - Present
Studentische Hilfskraft

Werkstudent - Flight Demonstrator Assembly & Component Testing @ Polaris Spaceplanes

CAD modelling, assembly, integration and testing of flight demonstrator parts; post-processing and analysis of flight tests; development of Python post-processing libraries and data infrastructure; involvement in test campaigns and integration tasks.

Aug. 2023 - Jan. 2024
Werkstudent

Propulsion Test Data Intern @ Rocket Factory Augsburg

Rocket engine hot-fire and cold-flow test data analysis using Python (numpy, scipy, pandas), visualization (matplotlib, plotly), automatic detection of test parameters, spectral analysis and documentation of test results.

Jan. 2023 - Apr. 2023
Data Intern - Propulsion Test Data

Propulsion & Design Intern @ SpanTrik

Design, manufacture and analysis of a sounding rocket (RAVEN); propulsion system testing and documentation; worked in cross-functional team under project deadlines.

Sep. 2021 - Dec. 2021
Propulsion & Design Intern

Werkstudent - Advanced Computational Laboratory, SRM Institute

Oct. 2018 - Jun. 2020
Werkstudent (Advance Computational Laboratory)

My Projects

GitHub

I2CVB Retinopathy

Repository associated with our medical imaging development related to retinopathy.

  • Star
  • Fork

VIPeR

VIsion Polarimétrique pour la navigation de Robots, a project dedicated to exploit polarization as an extra navigation tool for the robot

  • Star
  • Fork

Master Project: CFRP microcracks

Development and validation of a model for the simulation of cryogenically thermally induced microcracks in CFRP — simulation and experimental study.

  • Star
  • Fork

Web / Programming projects

Web development (HTML, CSS, progressing in JavaScript) and Python-based data processing and visualization projects; post-processing libraries for flight and test data.

  • Star
  • Fork

Heat Transfer & Flow Visualization

Academic projects including fin orientation on convective heat transfer, jet-impingement tunnel construction and experimental flow visualization.

  • Star
  • Fork
